alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON, BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 117 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Charles Towne Landing, or near Downtown Charleston, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Moncks Corner, Downtown Charleston, and West Ashley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Charleston; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley
